title: Get Started
text: Note: functions using nearest-neighbour graph RNA assay (RNA_nn), PLEASE change SCT_nn using SCT assay.
code: library(devtools)  install_github("https://github.com/CSI-Doherty/SCneighbours")  library(SCneighbours)

title: Get Started
text: individual cells cell groups, visualize cell neighbourhoods either dots density contours dimensionality reduction map, uncovering tightly interwoven widely dispersed regions. allows us learn clusters might need merging largely overlapped neighbourhoods, infer trajectory relationships cells obscured reduction.
code: visualize_neighbourhood(object, meta_data_column = "seurat_clusters", meta_data_highlight = "12", reduction = "umap", density = T)

title: Get Started
text: cell, quantify distribution neighbouring cells variance coordinates, providing insights cell positioning reduction map. Large variance indicates diminished confidence cell’s positioning.
code: calculate_neighbour_distance_for_all_cells(object, reduction = "umap", colname = "neighbourhood_variance")

title: Get Started
text: cell neighbourhoods can explored across various dimensionality reductions insights. example, diffusion map force-directed layout can provide clues cell development preserving continuous cell transitioning trajectories.

title: Tutorial
text: Load necessary libraries.
code: library(SCneighbours) library(Seurat) #> Loading required package: SeuratObject #> Loading required package: sp #> 'SeuratObject' was built under R 4.5.0 but the current version is #> 4.5.2; it is recomended that you reinstall 'SeuratObject' as the ABI #> for R may have changed #>  #> Attaching package: 'SeuratObject' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, t

title: Tutorial
text: use 3k PBMCs control pbmcs interferon B datasets.
code: SeuratData::InstallData("ifnb") #> Warning: The following packages are already installed and will not be #> reinstalled: ifnb SeuratData::InstallData("pbmc3k") #> Warning: The following packages are already installed and will not be #> reinstalled: pbmc3k  ifnb <- SeuratData::LoadData("ifnb") #> Validating object structure #> Updating object slots #> Ensuring keys are in the proper structure #> Warning: Assay RNA changing from Assay to Assay #> Ensuring keys are in the proper structure #> Ensuring feature names don't have underscores or pipes #> Updating slots in RNA #> Validating object structure for Assay 'RNA' #> Object representation is consistent with the most current Seurat version #> Warning: Assay RNA changing from Assay to Assay5 pbmc <- SeuratData::LoadData("pbmc3k") #> Validating object structure #> Updating object slots #> Ensuring keys are in the proper structure #> Warning: Assay RNA changing from Assay to Assay #> Ensuring keys are in the proper structure #> Ensuring feature names don't have underscores or pipes #> Updating slots in RNA #> Validating object structure for Assay 'RNA' #> Object representation is consistent with the most current Seurat version #> Warning: Assay RNA changing from Assay to Assay5  ifnb <- subset(ifnb, stim == 'CTRL')

title: Tutorial
text: PBMCs merged without integration Run standard pipeline generate nearest neighbour graph, clusters, UMAP reduction.   T cells (CD3 positive) split 2 clusters separate datasets.
code: seu <- merge(ifnb, pbmc) seu <- NormalizeData(seu) #> Normalizing layer: counts.ifnb #> Normalizing layer: counts.pbmc3k seu <- FindVariableFeatures(seu) #> Finding variable features for layer counts.ifnb #> Finding variable features for layer counts.pbmc3k seu <- ScaleData(seu) #> Centering and scaling data matrix seu <- RunPCA(seu, verbose = F)  seu <- FindNeighbors(seu, dims = 1:30, reduction = "pca") #> Computing nearest neighbor graph #> Computing SNN seu <- FindClusters(seu, resolution = 0.5) #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 9248 #> Number of edges: 391141 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.9226 #> Number of communities: 15 #> Elapsed time: 1 seconds   seu <- RunUMAP(seu, dims = 1:30, reduction = "pca", verbose = F) #> Warning: The default method for RunUMAP has changed from calling Python UMAP via reticulate to the R-native UWOT using the cosine metric #> To use Python UMAP via reticulate, set umap.method to 'umap-learn' and metric to 'correlation' #> This message will be shown once per session DimPlot(seu, group.by = c("orig.ident", "seurat_clusters")) FeaturePlot(seu, "CD3E")

title: Tutorial
text: Using SCneighbours can see neighbourhood sharing 2 seperate T cell clusters.
code: visualize_neighbourhood(seu, meta_data_column = 'seurat_clusters', meta_data_highlight = 1, 'umap', density = T) + visualize_neighbourhood(seu, meta_data_column = 'seurat_clusters', meta_data_highlight = 1, 'umap', density = F) visualize_neighbourhood(seu, 'seurat_clusters', 2, density = T, percent = 90) + visualize_neighbourhood(seu, 'seurat_clusters', 2, density = F)

title: Tutorial
text: heatmap showing neighbourhood sharing clusters can generated visualise_neighbour_percentage.
code: visualise_neighbour_percentage(seu, graph = 'RNA_nn', meta_data_column = 'seurat_clusters')

title: Tutorial
text: cell can calculate percentage cells neighbours share cells cluster (metadata column).  see can see high percentage cells form boundaries clusters, even boundaries don’t appear close together UMAP.
code: seu <- calculate_outside_neighbours_cell(seu, 'seurat_clusters',colname = 'outside_neighbourhood') FeaturePlot(seu, 'outside_neighbourhood')

title: Tutorial
text: cell can calculate variance distance neighbours based reductions embeddings. can useful see problems UMAP problamtic cells dataset.
code: seu <- calculate_neighbour_distance_for_all_cells(seu, reduction = 'umap', colname = 'neighbour_distance') FeaturePlot(seu, 'neighbour_distance') FeaturePlot(seu, 'neighbour_distance', min.cutoff = 'q5', max.cutoff = 'q95')

title: Authors and Citation
text: First Last. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Last F (2026). SCneighbours: Single-Cell Neighbourhood Exploration Tool. R package version 0.1.0, https://lachland.github.io/SCneighbours2/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SCneighbours: Single-Cell Neighbourhood Exploration Tool},   author = {First Last},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://lachland.github.io/SCneighbours2/}, }

title: Single-Cell Neighbourhood Exploration Tool
text: Single-Cell Neighbourhood Exploration Tool SCneighbours toolkitthat allows quantify visualize properties nearest neighbour graph underlying low-dimensional embeddings. tools allow better understand underlying complexities make informed interpretation downstream analyses. Get Started Tutorial example github.com/CSI-Doherty/SCneighbours Link article

title: CalculateContour — CalculateContour
text: Calculates kernel density estimate contour lines specific   cell population dimensionality reduction space. Uses 2D kernel density   estimation compute contours specified percentile level, useful   visualizing spatial distribution cell populations.

title: CalculateContour — CalculateContour
code: CalculateContour(   obj,   meta_data_column,   meta_data_highlight,   reduction = "umap",   percent = 95 )

title: CalculateContour — CalculateContour
text: obj Seurat, SingleCellExperiment SCNeighbours object containing single-cell data. Seurat SingleCellExperiment form first converted SCneighbours format meta_data_column Name metadata column object pull values identifying cells interest. meta_data_highlight specific value within meta_data_column calculate contours . reduction Name dimensionality reduction use (default: "umap"). percent Percentile level contour (default: 95). Higher values create tighter contours around densest regions.

title: CalculateContour — CalculateContour
text: data frame x y coordinates defining contour line.

title: CalculateContour — CalculateContour
text: Calculate Density Contour Lines Cell Populations

code: calculate_neighbour_distance_for_all_cells(   obj,   reduction = NULL,   colname,   graph = NULL )

title: calculate_neighbour_distance_for_all_cells. — calculate_neighbour_distance_for_all_cells
text: obj Seurat, SingleCellExperiment SCNeighbours object containing single-cell data. Seurat SingleCellExperiment form firist converted SCneighbours format reduction reduction map used calculate coordinate variance. colname column name store neighbourhood distance value metadata. graph either nearest neigbour graph igraph, dgCMatrix Seurat format, name graph stored Seurat object. (e.g., "RNA_nn", "RNA_snn", "SCT_nn").

Seurat SingleCellExperiment form firist converted SCneighbours format meta_data_column Name column seu@meta.data pull values grouping analysis. meta_data_highlight specific value within meta_data_column highlight analyze neighbours . graph either nearest neigbour graph igraph, dgCMatrix Seurat format, name graph stored Seurat object. (e.g., "RNA_nn", "RNA_snn", "SCT_nn").

Seurat SingleCellExperiment form firist converted SCneighbours format meta_data_column Name column seu@meta.data pull values grouping analysis. graph Name nearest-neighbour graph use seu@graphs (e.g., "RNA_nn", "RNA_snn", "SCT_nn").

title: calculate_outside_neighbours_cell — calculate_outside_neighbours_cell
text: cell, calculates percentage neighbours belong   different cell type/group . metric quantifies cellular   heterogeneity local neighbourhood can identify boundary cells   cells mixed microenvironments. result stored new column   Seurat object's metadata.

title: check_single_cell_object — check_single_cell_object
text: S3 scn_object following elements: type - Character string: "Seurat" "SingleCellExperiment" embeddings - Tibble selected reduction embeddings key - Character string embedding dimension name key metadata - Data frame cell metadata graphs - Seurat style nearest neighbour graph n_cells - Integer, number cells dataset cell_names - Character vector cell identifiers

title: visualize_neighbourhood — visualize_neighbourhood
text: Visualizes neighbours cells belonging specific group   dimensionality reduction plot (e.g., UMAP, t-SNE, PCA). Can display   neighbours either simple highlighted points density contours showing   spatial distribution patterns. helps understand cell types   interact spatially identify neighbourhood structures.

title: visualize_neighbourhood — visualize_neighbourhood
code: visualize_neighbourhood(   obj,   meta_data_column,   meta_data_highlight,   reduction = NULL,   density = F,   graph = "RNA_nn",   percent = 95 )

title: visualize_neighbourhood — visualize_neighbourhood
text: obj Seurat, SingleCellExperiment SCNeighbours object containing single-cell data. Seurat SingleCellExperiment form firist converted SCneighbours format meta_data_column Name metadata column object pull values identifying cells interest. meta_data_highlight specific value within meta_data_column analyze neighbours (e.g., specific cluster cell type). reduction Name dimensionality reduction plot (e.g., "umap", "tsne", "pca"). density Logical indicating whether plot density contours (TRUE) simple point highlights (FALSE). Default FALSE. graph either nearest neigbour graph igraph, dgCMatrix Seurat format, name graph stored Seurat object. (e.g., "RNA_nn", "RNA_snn", "SCT_nn"). percent Percentile level density contours density=TRUE (default: 95). used density=TRUE.

title: visualize_neighbourhood — visualize_neighbourhood
text: ggplot2 object showing dimensionality reduction neighbours   highlighted either red points (density=FALSE) density contours   (density=TRUE).

title: visualize_neighbourhood — visualize_neighbourhood
text: Visualize Cell Neighbourhoods Dimensionality Reduction
